channel.title: Wrong parameter count for mysql_query() in... F**k
channel.description:
Warning: Wrong parameter count for mysql_query() in /home/harold/public_html/news/index.php on line 147
[code] $sql = mysql_query("SELECT `title`,`content`,`date` FROM `news` WHERE `id` = ?", array($_GET['id']), true); [/code]
y u know work!?! :confused:
inb4rubyscreamsatme

item.title: Wrong parameter count for mysql_query() in... F**k
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:4, topic:472502”]I wouldn’t scream at you, you noob :P.

Personally I’d go with PDO and not with MySQLi. Just due to the multi-driver support.[/quote]
xD lol

Ill attempt to implement PDO and see where that leads me. tanks for the advice!

Fuck it, its pissing me off so im gonna take a break and wait until it finishes itself

Read full topic
item.source: Wrong parameter count for mysql_query() in... F**k

item.title: Wrong parameter count for mysql_query() in... F**k
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I wouldn’t scream at you, you noob :P.

Personally I’d go with PDO and not with MySQLi. Just due to the multi-driver support.

Read full topic
item.source: Wrong parameter count for mysql_query() in... F**k

item.title: Wrong parameter count for mysql_query() in... F**k
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:2, topic:472502”]The legacy mysql driver doesn’t support prepared statements like you’re trying to do here.
http://php.net/mysql_query

You can either use MySQLi or PDO which supports them, or you have to cleanse the data yourself and then have them placed in the query.[/quote]
Thanks :3
I didnt realize mysql_ was discouraged. I don’t really keep up to date lol

How am I supposed to use Msqli with this?

$sql = mysql_query("SELECT `title`,`content`,`date` FROM `news` WHERE `id` = ?", array($_GET['id']), true);

Im not trying to get you to spoon feed meh but im just not the sharpest tool in the shed takes me some time.

Read full topic
item.source: Wrong parameter count for mysql_query() in... F**k

item.title: Wrong parameter count for mysql_query() in... F**k
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

The legacy mysql driver doesn’t support prepared statements like you’re trying to do here.
http://php.net/mysql_query

You can either use MySQLi or PDO which supports them, or you have to cleanse the data yourself and then have them placed in the query.

Read full topic
